author: pintail_xyz
content:
Hello. Can I check I've got the right value for `EPOCHS_PER_SYNC_COMMITTEE_PERIOD`? In <@!273808422753796097>'s annotated spec (https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/blob/master/altair/beacon-chain.md#misc-1) we have a value of `Epoch(2**9) (= 512)` but in (I think) the current spec the value is `uint64(2**8) (= 256)` (see https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/altair/beacon-chain.md#sync-committee).

I'm guessing this is just a change that was made since the last update of the annotated spec, is that right?

author: pintail_xyz
content: I've put the updated value in a pull request: https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/pull/24

author: potuz
content: The PR that changed the period also changed the weights and added a penalty, I haven't read the annotated spec but I can imagine that if Vitalik didn't update the period then probably didn't update the others
